data.chText: 看；注视；观看；观察
data.enText: to look at sb/sth for a time, paying attention to what happens

data.chText: 看电视 / 足球比赛
data.enText: to watch television/a football game

data.chText: 他注视着那所房子里的动静。
data.enText: He watched the house for signs of activity.

data.chText: 他注视着那所房子里的动静。
data.enText: He watched for signs of activity in the house.

data.chText: “你想玩吗？”“不啦，谢谢。我就看看好了。”
data.enText: ‘Would you like to play?’ ‘No thanks─I'll just watch.’

data.chText: 我们注视着下一步要发生的事情。
data.enText: We watched to see what would happen next.

data.chText: 你注意看我的动作，然后试着做。
data.enText: Watch what I do, then you try.

data.chText: 她看着孩子们在院子里玩。
data.enText: She watched the kids playing in the yard.

data.chText: 他们注视着公共汽车消失在远方。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+不带to的不定式

data.enText: They watched the bus disappear into the distance.

data.chText: （短时间）照看，看护，照管
data.enText: to take care of sb/sth for a short time

data.chText: 我去买份报纸，你能替我照看一下我的包吗？
data.enText: Could you watch my bags for me while I buy a paper?
mind

data.chText: 小心；当心；留意
data.enText: to be careful about sth

data.chText: 当心！
data.enText: Watch yourself (= be careful, because you're in a dangerous situation) !

data.chText: 小心你的提包，这里有小偷。
data.enText: Watch your bag─there are thieves around.

data.chText: 我必须掂量着花每一分钱。
data.enText: I have to watch every penny (= be careful what I spend) .

data.chText: 天花板很低，当心别碰着头。
data.enText: Watch your head on the low ceiling.

data.chText: 嘿，瞧着点路！
data.enText: Hey, watch where you're going!
watch the clock

data.chText: 盯着钟表（算计着不超过规定的工作时间，或只盼望下班而无心工作）
data.enText: to be careful not to work longer than the required time; to think more about when your work will finish than about the work itself
a watched pot never boils

data.chText: 心急水不开（越心急，时间过得越慢）
data.enText: used to say that when you are impatient for sth to happen, time seems to pass very slowly
watch it

data.chText: 当心；留神；注意
data.enText: used as a warning to sb to be careful
watch your mouth/tongue

data.chText: 说话当心；嘴上留个把门的
data.enText: to be careful what you say in order not to offend sb or make them angry
watch the time

data.chText: 注意时间（以便按时完成或到达）
data.enText: to be sure that you know what the time is, so that you finish sth at the correct time, or are not late for sth

data.chText: 我得看着点时间。今天我要早走。
data.enText: I'll have to watch the time. I need to leave early today.
watch this space

data.chText: （用于命令）等待下面发表的消息
data.enText: used in orders, to tell sb to wait for more news about sth to be announced

data.chText: 目前我不能跟你多说，等着听下面发表的消息吧。
data.enText: I can't tell you any more right now, but watch this space.
watch the world go by

data.chText: 闲看人来人往；静观众生百态
data.enText: to relax and watch people in a public place

data.chText: 我们坐在一家小餐馆外面，望着眼前来来往往的人们。
data.enText: We sat outside a cafe, watching the world go by.
mind/watch your language

data.chText: 谨慎措辞；留神言辞
data.enText: to be careful about what you say in order not to upset or offend sb

data.chText: 年轻人，注意你的言谈！
data.enText: Watch your language, young man!
mind/watch your step

data.chText: 走路小心
data.enText: to walk carefully

data.chText: 言行小心谨慎
data.enText: to behave in a careful and sensible way
watch for sb/sth

data.chText: 观察等待（某人出现或发生某事）
data.enText: to look and wait for sb/sth to appear or for sth to happen

data.chText: 那只猫在墙上伺机捕捉鸟儿。
data.enText: The cat was on the wall, watching for birds.
watch out

data.chText: 小心；留神；注意
data.enText: used to warn sb about sth dangerous

data.chText: 小心！汽车来了！
data.enText: Watch out! There's a car coming!
watch out for sb/sth

data.chText: 密切注意；留意
data.enText: to make an effort to be aware of what is happening, so that you will notice if anything bad or unusual happens

data.chText: 出纳员接到要求，要注意伪钞。
data.enText: The cashiers were asked to watch out for forged banknotes.

data.chText: 小心；当心
data.enText: to be careful of sth

data.chText: 小心楼梯，这些台阶很陡。
data.enText: Watch out for the stairs─they're steep.
watch over sb/sth

data.chText: 照管；监督；保护
data.enText: to take care of sb/sth; to guard and protect sb/sth

data.chText: 表；手表；（旧时的）怀表
data.enText: a type of small clock that you wear on your wrist, or (in the past) carried in your pocket

data.chText: 她焦急不安地一个劲儿看表。
data.enText: She kept looking anxiously at her watch.

data.chText: 我的表快 / 慢了。
data.enText: My watch is fast/slow.

data.chText: 注意；注视；监视；观察
data.enText: the act of watching sb/sth carefully in case of possible danger or problems

data.chText: 警方已在旅馆外面布置人监视。
data.enText: The police have mounted a watch outside the hotel.

data.chText: 你查阅他的文件，我来放哨。
data.enText: I'll keep watch while you go through his papers (= watch and warn you if somebody is coming) .

data.chText: 政府正在密切注视着形势的发展。
data.enText: The government is keeping a close watch on how the situation develops.

data.chText: 值班（人）；警戒（人）；守夜（人）
data.enText: a fixed period of time, usually while other people are asleep, during which sb watches for any danger so that they can warn others, for example on a ship; the person or people who do this

data.chText: 我值第一班。
data.enText: I'm on first watch .

data.chText: 我一个小时后值班。
data.enText: I go on watch in an hour.
be on the watch (for sb/sth)

data.chText: 小心提防；警戒
data.enText: to be looking carefully for sb/sth that you expect to see, especially in order to avoid possible danger

data.chText: 要提防小偷。
data.enText: Be on the watch for thieves.
keep a close eye/watch on sb/sth

data.chText: 密切注视；严密监视
data.enText: to watch sb/sth carefully

data.chText: 在今后的几个月里我们将密切关注销售情况。
data.enText: Over the next few months we will keep a close eye on sales.

data.text: look ♦ watch ♦ see ♦ view ♦ observe ♦ regard

data.chText: 以上各词均含看、观看之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to turn your eyes in a particular direction.
look

data.chText: 指看、瞧：
data.enText: to turn your eyes in a particular direction

data.chText: 你要是仔细看，从这里就可以看见我们的房子。
data.enText: If you look carefully you can just see our house from here.

data.chText: 她看了看我，笑了。
data.enText: She looked at me and smiled.
watch

data.chText: 指看、注视、观看、观察：
data.enText: to look at sb/sth for a time, paying attention to what happens

data.chText: 看电视
data.enText: to watch television

data.chText: 你注意看我的动作，然后试着做。
data.enText: Watch what I do, then you try.
see

data.chText: 指观看（比赛、电视节目、演出等）：
data.enText: to watch a game, television programme, performance, etc.

data.chText: 晚上，我们去看了一场电影。
data.enText: In the evening we went to see a movie.
view

data.chText: 指看、观看（尤指仔细观察）；看（电视、电影等）：
data.enText: ( formal ) to look at sth, especially when you look carefully; to watch television, a film/movie, etc.

data.chText: 观众从世界各地涌来欣赏她的作品。
data.enText: People came from all over the world to view her work.

data.chText: 用watch、see还是view？
可以说see/view a film/movie/programme，但不能说：
data.enText: You can see/view a film/movie/programme but you cannot
see/view television

data.chText: view较see正式，尤用于商务语境。
data.enText: View is more formal than see and is used especially in business contexts.
watch, see or view?
observe

data.chText: 指观察、注视、监视：
data.enText: ( formal ) to watch sb/sth carefully, especially to learn more about them or it

data.chText: 这些病人被观察了数月之久。
data.enText: The patients were observed over a period of several months.
regard

data.chText: 尤指以某种方式注视、凝视：
data.enText: to look at sb/sth, especially in a particular way

data.chText: 他以怀疑的眼光看着我们。
data.enText: He regarded us suspiciously.
to look/watch for sb/sth
to watch/observe what/who/how…
to look/watch/view/observe/regard (sb/sth) in/with amazement/surprise/disapproval, etc.
to look (at sb/sth)/watch (sb/sth)/observe sb/sth/regard sb/sth carefully/closely/intently
to watch/see/view a film/movie/programme
to watch/see a match/game/fight

ex.enText: She covered her eyes, afraid to look.

synonyms.bx: 侧重短暂的看的动作，但并不一定能看见，有时用来唤起别人的注意。

ex.chText: 我们难以观察到月亮的另一面。
ex.enText: The far side of the moon is difficult for us to observe.

ex.chText: 数以千计的人观看了轮船离港下水的情形。
ex.enText: Thousands of people observed the ship leaving the harbour.

ex.chText: 这名科学家仔细观察标本。
ex.enText: The scientist carefully observed the specimen.

synonyms.bx: 指注意到某事物，或为了解某人、某事而对其进行仔细观察。

ex.chText: 我发觉他的行为有些变化。
ex.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour.

ex.chText: 我看不出这些图片有什么差别。
ex.enText: I can't perceive any difference between these pictures.
She is perceived as the future president.

synonyms.bx: 指发现或意识到某事；也指以某种方式理解某人或某事。

ex.chText: 他看了看，但什么也没有看见。
从这儿可以看到好几英里远。
ex.enText: You can see for miles from here.

ex.chText: 你昨晚看那个节目了吗？
ex.enText: Did you see that programme last night?

synonyms.bx: 侧重看的结果；也指眼睛看得见或观看比赛、电视节目等。

ex.chText: 下次你们参观动物园，要仔细观察老虎。
ex.enText: Next time you visit the zoo, watch the tigers carefully.

ex.chText: 你能推荐一个我们可以观看美丽日出的地方吗？
ex.enText: Can you recommend a place where we can watch the beautiful sunrise?

synonyms.bx: 指在一段时间内关注某人或某事。

data.enText: watch the clock

data.chText: 我们坐在一家小餐馆外面，望着眼前来来往往的人们。
data.enText: We sat outside a cafe, watching the world go by.
mind/watch your language

data.enText: to be careful about what you say in order not to upset or offend sb

data.chText: 年轻人，注意你的言谈！
data.enText: Watch your language, young man!

data.chText: 走路小心
data.enText: to walk carefully

data.chText: 言行小心谨慎
data.enText: to behave in a careful and sensible way
be on the watch (for sb/sth)

data.enText: Be on the watch for thieves.

data.chText: 密切注视；严密监视
data.enText: to watch sb/sth carefully

data.chText: 在今后的几个月里我们将密切关注销售情况。
data.enText: Over the next few months we will keep a close eye on sales.
watch for sb/sth

data.chText: 观察等待（某人出现或发生某事）
data.enText: to look and wait for sb/sth to appear or for sth to happen

data.chText: 那只猫在墙上伺机捕捉鸟儿。
data.enText: The cat was on the wall, watching for birds.
watch out

data.chText: 小心；留神；注意
data.enText: used to warn sb about sth dangerous

data.chText: 小心！汽车来了！
data.enText: Watch out! There's a car coming!
watch out for sb/sth

data.chText: 密切注意；留意
data.enText: to make an effort to be aware of what is happening, so that you will notice if anything bad or unusual happens

data.chText: 出纳员接到要求，要注意伪钞。
data.enText: The cashiers were asked to watch out for forged banknotes.

data.chText: 小心；当心
data.enText: to be careful of sth

data.chText: 小心楼梯，这些台阶很陡。
data.enText: Watch out for the stairs─they're steep.
watch over sb/sth

data.chText: 照管；监督；保护
data.enText: to take care of sb/sth; to guard and protect sb/sth

trans: 小心，提防（不愉快的事情或陷入困境）

tr: a purposeful surveillance to guard or observe
the rite of staying awake for devotional purposes (especially on the eve of a religious festival)
a person employed to keep watch for some anticipated event
a period of time (4 or 2 hours) during which some of a ship's crew are on duty
the period during which someone (especially a guard) is on duty
find out, learn, or determine with certainty, usually by making an inquiry or other effort
example: I want to see whether she speaks French
find out if he speaks Russian
Check whether the train leaves on time
They watched as the murderer was executed
Watch how the dog chases the cats away
This program will be seen all over the world

tr: be vigilant, be on the lookout or be careful
follow with the eyes or the mind
example: Keep an eye on the baby, please!
She followed the men with the binoculars

value.def: If you watch someone or something, you look at them, usually for a period of time, and pay attention to what is happening.

example.ex: The man was standing in his doorway watching him...
example.tran: 那个男人站在门口盯着他看。

example.ex: He watched the barman prepare the beer he had ordered...
example.tran: 他看着酒吧招待员备好他点的啤酒。

example.ex: Chris watched him sipping his brandy...
example.tran: 克里斯注视着他品尝白兰地。

example.ex: I watched as Amy ate a few nuts.
example.tran: 我看着埃米吃了几粒坚果。

value.def: If you watch something on television or an event such as a sports match, you spend time looking at it, especially when you see it from the beginning to the end.

example.ex: I'd stayed up late to watch the film...
example.tran: 我熬夜看了那场电影。

example.ex: They spent a great deal of time watching television.
example.tran: 他们很多时间都看电视了。

value.tran: 看，观看(电视节目、比赛等)

value.def: If you watch a situation or event, you pay attention to it or you are aware of it, but you do not influence it.

example.ex: Human rights groups have been closely watching the case...
example.tran: 人权组织一直在密切关注此案。

example.ex: Annoyed commuters could only watch as the departure time ticked by.
example.tran: 随着发车时间一点点过去，恼怒的上班族只能干瞪眼。

value.tran: 对…保持关注;掌握…的情况

value.def: If you watch people, especially children or animals, you are responsible for them, and make sure that they are not in danger.

example.ex: Parents can't be expected to watch their children 24 hours a day.
example.tran: 父母不可能每天24小时照看孩子。

value.tran: 照看，看护(尤指孩子或动物)

value.boxu_tran: 可以用 watch 或 look at 来表示某人注意看某事物。一般来讲，watch表示注视移动或变化的事物，look at 表示注视静止的事物：I ask him to look at the picture above his head (我让他看他上方的画)，He watched Black run down the staris (他看着布莱克跑下楼)。see 表示由于眼睛接收到视觉图像而看到东西，表达此义时常用can: I can see the fax here on the desk (我能看见这边桌上的那份传真)。
value.boxu_usage: If you want to say that someone is paying attention to something they can see, you say that they are watching or looking at it. In general, you watch something that is moving or changing, and you look at something that is not moving. I asked him to look at the picture above his bed... He watched Blake run down the stairs. You use see to talk about things that you are aware of because a visual impression reaches your eyes. You often use can in this case. I can see the fax here on the desk.

value.def: If you watch someone, you follow them secretly or spy on them.

example.ex: Ella was scared that someone was watching her...
example.tran: 有个人一直在监视埃拉，这让她很害怕。

example.ex: I always had the feeling we were being watched.
example.tran: 我总感觉我们被监视了。

value.def: If you tell someone to watch a particular person or thing, you are warning them to be careful that the person or thing does not get out of control or do something unpleasant.

example.ex: You really ought to watch these quiet types...
example.tran: 你真的应该留神这些寡言少语的人。

example.ex: If you're watching the calories, don't have mayonnaise.
example.tran: 如果你在意卡路里的摄入量，就不要吃蛋黄酱。

value.def: A watch is a period of carefully looking and listening, often while other people are asleep and often as a military duty, so that you can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: I had the first watch that May evening.
example.tran: 我第一次执行警戒任务是在那个五月的晚上。

value.def: If someone keeps watch, they look and listen all the time, while other people are asleep or doing something else, so that they can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: Jose, as usual, had climbed a tree to keep watch.
example.tran: 乔斯像往常一样爬到树上放哨。

value.def: If you keep watch on events or a situation, you pay attention to what is happening, so that you can take action at the right moment.

example.ex: US officials have been keeping close watch on the situation.
example.tran: 美国官员一直密切注意着事态的发展。

value.def: You say 'watch it' in order to warn someone to be careful, especially when you want to threaten them about what will happen if they are not careful.

example.ex: 'Now watch it, Patsy,' the Sergeant told her.
example.tran: “留点神，帕齐。”中士提醒她。

value.def: If someone is on watch, they have the job of carefully looking and listening, often while other people are asleep and often as a military duty, so that they can warn them of danger or an attack.

example.ex: Apart from two men on watch in the engine-room, everyone was asleep.
example.tran: 除了两个人在机房值班外，其他人都在睡觉。

value.tran: （通常指军队夜间的）警戒，值夜

value.def: If you are on the watch for something, you are expecting it to happen and you therefore pay attention to events so that you will notice it when it does happen.

example.ex: Environmentalists will be on the watch for damage to wildlife.
example.tran: 环境保护主义者将会密切关注对野生动物造成的伤害。

value.def: If someone is being kept under watch, they are being guarded or observed all the time.
value.tran: 受到保卫;受到监视;被密切关注

value.def: You say to someone 'you watch' or 'just watch' when you are predicting that something will happen, and you are very confident that it will happen as you say.

example.ex: You watch. Things will get worse before they get better.
example.tran: 看着吧，事情在好转之前会先恶化。

value.def: A watch is a small clock which you wear on a strap on your wrist, or on a chain.
